data.Services: Practical and emotional suppport, advice and guidance with accessing support services
Process: Complete a referral form for a client (available on website)

data.Services: Support services for those who are experiencing gender based violence (domestic violence, rape and sexual assault, stalking, prostitution, sexual exploitation, trafficking for sexual exploitation, FGM, forced marriage, "honour"-based violence)
Clients: Victims of gender-based violence (please see the column services for more details)

data.Services: Therapy, housing, support
Clients: Women without children who have been trafficked

data.Services: provider of domestic abuse refuges in London
Process: Referral via National Referral Mechanism only

data.Services: Largest provider of accommodation and outreach support in London and assist female, male and transgender survivors of trafficking ranging from the exploitation of the prostitution of others or other forms of sexual exploitation, forced labour or services, domestic servitude, slavery or practices similar to slavery servitude to the removal of organs. 5 safe houses and expanded community outreach service.
Advice and information (housing, immigration), one to one appointments, skills workshops and accompanying service to appointments
Process: Complete referral form for a client (available on website) and send to referrals@hibiscus.org.uk; response no later than 5 working days
Clients: Women (no mention on any specific services for victims of DV)

data.Services:
Support services for Asian women. Staff 
speak Bengali, English, Hindi and Urdu.
Process: Welfare advice, ESOL and Older Women's Group require appointments (email or phone). Domestic violence support is accessible via drop-in.
Day: MON/TUE (Welfare Advice): Appointment only. TUE & THU (ESOL): 10am - 12pm. THU: (Domestic Violence support, drop-in): 9.30am - 5pm, THU: Older Women's Social Group:  10am -2pm.

data.Services: Advice and information

data.Organisation:
Hounslow Domestic violence 
ONE STOP SHOP
data.Services: Advice and information
Empowering women through providing good quality homes, and support to women who have experienced domestic violence, trafficking and mothers leaving prison.

Support, advice and guidance. Weekly 
wellbeing classes also available.
Process: Drop-in on Wednesday, counselling and support also available by appointment - call or email for more information

data.Services: Provider of support and safe house provision for the victims of human trafficking
Process: Referral via National Referral Mechanism only
Clients: Women without children who have been trafficked

data.Services: Immigration advice and casework, Housing and homelessness, family law, income and finacial assistance, health and psychosocial support, prison and hospital outreach,
Process:
contact Juliane Heider either by email to
juliane.heider@praxis.org.uk or by phone
Clients:
destitute London-based migrants who have experienced trafficking and/or gender-based
violence, including domestic violence and exploitation, sexual violence and rape, female genital mutilation, forced
prostitution, forced marriage, honour-based crimes and other forms of persecution on the basis of their gender and/or
sexuality.

data.Services:
Helpline, advocacy, one to one counselling, 
body therapies, friendsÂ & family counselling, 
group support and therapy
Process: Call or email advice@solacewomensaid.org for information
Day: Monday 10am-2pm, Tuesday 10am-1pm & 6-8pm, Wednesday and Thursday 1-5pm, Friday 10-2pm
Clients: Women and girls over 13 who have experienced sexual violence

data.Services: Education, training, employment
Telephone Adviceline (immigration, family)

Immigration, benefits, housing advice and advocacy, signposting for Albanian asylum-seekers and refugees, activities, schools and mentoring  for Albanian speaking children, support groups, therapy sessions and training for women, advice and advocacy for women victims of domestic violence.

data.Organisation:
The Bike Project-Cycle 
Training with Refugee Women
data.Services: Activities
Process: All the bikes are provided during the lesson and donated after the end of the course. To refer/book a place contact Claire: 07410114140, claire@thebikeproject.co.uk

data.Services: Advice, assistance, education and activities
Process: For appointments, Tues/Thu 10am -12pm, call or email. For drop-ins, see Column1

data.Services: Counselling, advice and activities programme
Process: Tuesday: Drop In 10.30 - 15.30, Wednesday Drop In - 10:00 - 16:00. Call or email to book appointments outside of these times.
Tel: 020 7739 2950/ 07805 061908 (to book for appointments Monday or Thursday)
Day: Mon - Fri (for specific class/ advice times see website)
